intro: Microgenetes cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's microgenetes, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and fern-like leaves. It grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
